title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the ajc command to compile source files and create a jar file using the outjar option, the resulting jar file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
OB: After calling ajc with the sourceroots option set to <mydir> and the outjar option set to <my.jar>, an output file is generated. However, the generated file has a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
EB: I expect that when using the outjar option, the resulting jar file should contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Call ajc with the sourceroots option set to <mydir> and the outjar option set to <my.jar>.
2. Verify that the output file is created with a .jar extension.
3. Inspect the contents of the generated jar file and confirm that it lacks a MANIFEST.MF file.
